titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of Arrington Dixon Papers at DC Public Library
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by DC Africana Archives Project, 2014. The collection was reprocessed and finding aid updated by Julie Burns, 2019.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-02-09 10:03:56 -0500.

change.item: Series 2, 3, and 4 added to the finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is divided into four series:
Series 1: Campaigns
Series 2: City Government
Series 3: Personal
Series 4: Photographs

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Arrington Dixon is a local politician who served on the District of Columbia City Council as a Representative of Ward 4, Chairman, and an At-Large Member. Dixon was born in Washington, DC on December 3, 1942. He attended Birney Elementary, Douglass Junior High School, and McKinley Technical High School where he participated in the Cadet Corps program. Dixon went on to attend college at Howard University where he studied economic statistics, math, and physics; and participated in the Air Force ROTC. He transferred to the Air Force Academy for a short time, but returned to Howard following the 1964 death of his brother James W. Dixon, Jr., who served in the United States Air Force. After his graduation in 1966, Dixon worked for various institutions as a computer/systems analyst and educator. He ran for the Ward 5 Board of Education seat in 1968, which he ultimately lost. In 1972, Dixon earned a law degree from George Washington University. He ran for the then-newly established DC City Council in 1974, serving as Ward 4 Representative from 1975 to 1979, City Council Chairman from 1979 to 1982, and later for a brief period of time as an At-Large Member in 1997. Dixon was also involved with the District of Columbia Taxicab Commission and a number of other community groups such as the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments, the National Capital Planning Commission, and DC Citizens for Better Public Education. Dixon married future District of Columbia Mayor Sharon Pratt (Kelly) in 1966. Their marriage ended in 1982. Dixon and Kelly have two children, Aimee and Drew. Since serving as an elected official, Dixon founded Arrington Dixon and Associates, Inc. (ADAI) a professional consulting and public liaison service.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Arrington Dixon donated this collection to the DC Public Library's Special Collections Department in August 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p:
This collection was originally processed in 2014 as part of the DC Africana Archives Project, funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources Hidden Collections.
The collection was reprocessed in 2019, and was divided into series and subseries and arranged chronologically thereunder, with related material grouped together. Oversized photographs are located in Box 14 and additional oversize materials are stored together in Box 17.
Throughout processing, paper clips and loose, rusty, and/or warped staples were removed; folded papers were unfolded and pressed flat; and folders and binders were disassembled. Photographs were covered in protective sleeves. The processor made redacted copies of items containing personal or private information. The majority of newspaper clippings were photocopied; however, full-size newspapers were separated from other items with a sheet of acid-free paper. The processor relabeled and refoldered, as needed.
The following items were removed from the collection and discarded: duplicates (more than two); original newspaper clippings; blank papers; envelopes containing no contextual or relevant information; and original folders, binders, and storage containers. The processor also shredded any originals containing personal or private information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p:
Related Collections:
Collection 029: Hilda Mason Papers
Collection 131: Charlene Drew Jarvis Papers
Collection 002: District of Columbia Citizens for Better Public Education Records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Arrington Dixon Papers Collection contains materials including campaign ephemera; correspondence; newspaper clippings and publications; photographs; pamphlets; and other documents related to Dixon's political campaigns, work in city government (especially for the District of Columbia City Council), and personal life. The bulk of the collection covers 1953 to 1989.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the researcher's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains items such as candidate questionnaires, voter surveys, fundraising and budget materials, meeting agendas and notes, schedules, ephemera (bumper stickers, pamphlets, flyers, buttons, advertisements, etc.), correspondence, press releases, and newspaper clippings related to Arrington Dixon's political campaigns when he ran for the District of Columbia City Council. This series is divided into five (5) sub-series: Sub-Series 1: Outreach, Events, and Planning, Sub-Series 2: Fundraising and Financials; Sub-Series 3: Campaign Ephemera; Sub-Series 4: Publications; and Sub-Series 5: Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains candidate questionnaires, voter surveys, meeting agendas and notes, event flyers and programs, schedules, and speeches and statements pertaining to Arrington Dixon's political campaigns, especially through voter outreach, planning, and strategy.

did.unittitle: Advance Manual for the Evelyn E. Murphy Campaign
Comprehensive Planning Document: Arrington Dixon, Chairman, DC City Council
Survey of Voter Attitudes and Opinions
Appendix C: Tabulations, Vol. 1, DC Voters Survey
Arrington Dixon Campaign Committee and Groups

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains fundraising, budgeting, and financial materials related to Arrignton Dixon's political campaigns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains campaign advertisements, campaign literature, bumper stickers, buttons, flyers, and voter guides from Arrington Dixon's political campaigns, as well as some items from other candidates' campaigns.

did.unittitle: Campaign Literature and Advertisements, Other Candidates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains press releases, newsletters, and newspaper clippings related to Arrington Dixon's political campaigns.

did.unittitle: Press Releases, Newsletters, and Newspaper Clippings
Press Releases, Newsletters, and Newspaper Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains correspondence pertaining to Arrington Dixon's political campaigns, including some letters related to campaign fundraising contributions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains items such as budget materials, speeches, statements, information about bills and legislation, invitations, correspondence, event programs and materials, newsletters, newspaper clippings, and press releases related to Arrington Dixon's time spent serving on the District of Columbia City Council and the DC Taxicab Commission. This series is divided into five (5) sub-series: Sub-Series 1: Financials, Sub-Series 2: Speeches and Actions; Sub-Series 3: Calendar and Events, Sub-Series 4: Publications, and 5 Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains Arrington Dixon's copies of the Budget of the District of Columbia for FY1977 - FY1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains speeches, statements, and information about bills and legislation from Arrington Dixon's time spent serving on the District of Columbia City Council and the DC Taxicab Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains invitations, correspondence, and event programs and materials from Arrington Dixon's time spent serving on the District of Columbia City Council.

did.unittitle: Thank You Letters and Drawings from La Salle Elementary School Students

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains newsletters, articles, newspaper clippings, press releases, and other publications related to Arrington Dixon, the District of Columbia City Council, and the DC Taxicab Commission.

scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains cards, letters, and copies of correspondence from Arrington Dixon's time serving on the District of Columbia City Council.

did.unittitle: DC City Council Correspondence, July and August 1977

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains programs, awards, correspondence, official documents, newspaper clippings, certificates, notes, and drawings related to Arrington Dixon's personal life, especially with regard to his education, professional life, and family. Series 3 is divided into three sub-series: Sub-Series 1: School, Work, and Church, Sub-Series 2: Family, and Sub-Series 3: Miscellaneous Items, and Sub-Series 4: Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains programs, awards, certificates, correspondence, and various other items related to Arrington Dixon's accomplishments and activities through school, work, and church.

did.unittitle: A Visit Through History: DC Council Photos
District of Columbia Federation of Civic Associations Thirty Eighth Annual Awards Dinner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, official documents, programs, newspaper clippings, certificates, some genealogical research, and other items related to members of Arrington Dixon's family, especially his father and mother (James W. Dixon, Sr. and Sallie Dixon) and brother (James W. Dixon, Jr.), who died while serving in the United States Air Force.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains miscellaneous notes, drawings, and items whose owner is unclear.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains images (photographs, contact sheets, and negatives) of Arrington Dixon, Dixon's time campaigning and serving on the District of Columbia City Council, and the Dixon family.
